ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Learned more about the history of Black spirituals and black art songs in the US
Learned the life stories an d styles of different black american composers
Got FREE weekly voice lessons to improve our singing abilities!
I learned how to effectively accompany singers in the context of art songs. I also became much more familiar with the works Black American composers and the origins of spirituals.
Lots of practicing singing in front of the class and performing for others. New knowledge of prominent Black composers of art song, notable poets, and famous historical performers of Black Art songs.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: voice lessons, Professor team is very generous and really want to see you succeed, free weekly voice lessons, getting to interact with talented singers/musicians. I also really liked the small class size
Weaknesses: I think voice lessons could have been more specific feedback behind the physical technicalities of singing, as that was something I personally struggled with.

I really enjoyed being able to perform pieces in class and hear feedback from Prof. Lalli and my peers. I also enjoyed the repertoire this semester, especially since it was by composers with whom I was not familiar before. I would not make any changes to this course, as I really enjoyed the flexible nature of the class.
The biggest strengths are Prof Lalli and Sara Kohane. They both care so much about their students and their improvement and learning over the semester. They have an incredible wealth of knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if you enjoy singing or are a pianist I highly recommend it! It's very fun class and I learned a lot. Plus you get free voice lessons every week to work on your selected pieces.

I would definitely recommend taking this course! Professor Lalli is wonderful and knows a ton about art songs. There is not much work beyond learning your pieces, so it was a really enjoyable and fulfilling music performance class.
If singing technique is something that you'd like to explore further, or if you love performing, absolutely take this class. You'll be better for it!
